name: **Lamb’s Island**
description: Lamb’s Island V516-585 Sheet 83 / Sheet 84 Lamb’s Island lies NNW of Abbey Island and is separated from it by the narrowest of deep channels. The channel may dry at the lowest of spring tides. This island combines with Abbey Island to shelter Derrynane Harbour at V517-287. The harbour is used equally by working and pleasure boats, including in summer, a sailing and canoeing school at V520-584. There is a working pier at V514-592 and an abandoned fish processing plant at V508-588. Choose your launching spot beforehand with care, as all the approach roads are twisty and narrow. Camping is possible at the outside end of the narrow channel at V516-585, with some privacy despite so many holidaymakers. The beaches are gravel and therefore uninteresting to most tourists. There is a decrepit fish-holding tank at the N end. The SW side is indented and interesting.
